channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Broken abandoned bikes attached to telegraph pole, 24th June
item.description:
3 bikes attached to telegraph pole with missing wheels, rusty and broken. Present for at least 6 months. Situated on telegraph pole between 24 and 26 kimberley road.

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Kimberley Road, Elmers End, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Ivy super overgrown and blocking pavement, 24th June
item.description:
With the leak which is making the pavement slick with algae, the overgrown ivy is making the pavement even move dangerous as people strain to avoid it and are much more likely to slip into the road. Please can it be trimmed back substantially from the Old Coach House gates to the Riverside Gardens playpark entrance urgently.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 1, High Street, Poverest, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.description:

item.title: Trash everywhere, 24th June
item.description:
Colomb street is one of the filthiest streets of Greenwich. I don’t understand what happens, but it’s so frustrating to everyday see big amounts of trash scattered all across the street. Would it be the foxes, the lack of care of our residents? Who knows, but we pay taxes to have clean streets!!

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 65, Colomb Street, East Greenwich, London
Report on FixMyStreet
